title: Are there any institutions in india to pursue planetary science? - Quora

response.answer_text: If by Planetary Science you mean space science then is of various types: Astronautics/Space TravelAstrophysicsBiology of Other PlanetsGalactic ScienceNon-Earth Planetary ScienceSpace ColonizationSpace DefenseStellar Science A B.Sc or a Bachelor of Engineering degree is required for advanced studies in Planetary sciences.The percentage of marks vary from institute to institute but ,you can expect the minimum percentage for admission to a good institute to start from 55%.As for competitive exams, it also depends from institute to institute.However, clearing entrance exams( such as Joint Entrance Screening Test for advanced course or UGC NET for teaching) is required for post graduate level or Research level course.There are lot of institutes for pursuing planetary science in India. few government institutes are there i am familiar with only two of them. these two are very popular and also have their particular reputation in this field. Indian Institute Of Space Science And Technology -   (Hindi: भारतीय अंतरिक्ष विज्ञान एवं प्रौद्योगिकी संस्थान) (IIST) is a government-aided institute and deemed university for the study and research of space science, located at Valiamala, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. It is the first university in Asia to be solely dedicated to the study and research of Outer space. it was set up by ISRO. A P J Abdul Kalam was chancellor of this institute. it offers regular engineering undergraduate, postgraduate and doctorate programmes with focus on space science, technology and applications. University Of Allahabad- The Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences (DEPS) was established in the year 1985. It is a FIST-sponsored Level-II department recognized by the Department of Science and Technology, Govt. of India.  The DEPS is known for its scientific contributions in frontier areas of research in Earth and Planetary Sciences in India and abroad.The adequate research facilities in Earth and Planetary Sciences, A.U. are available in the Department and our University facility to nurture budding Earth and Planetary scientists to purse their studies and research.  The students of this Department have excelled in teaching, research and industry in India and abroad. Various Short Courses and Workshops in Earth and Planetary Sciences and Applied Geo science are conducted by the Department from time to time. This Department is visited by reputed scientists from India and abroad to teach, conduct collaborative research and interact with students in evolving areas of Earth and Planetary Sciences.
